items.title: reverse_lazy() in settings.LOGIN_URL
items.body:
- Which version of Django are you using?: **2.2.4**
- Which version of django-rosetta are you using?: **0.9.4**
- Have you looked trough [recent issues](https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) and checked this isn't a duplicate? **Yes**

Hi. When I set settings.LOGIN_URL to reverse_lazy() instead of simple string, I get following exception when the user is not logged in:

Exception:
```
Internal Server Error: /rosetta/files/project/
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 34, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "django/core/handlers/base.py", line 115, in _get_response
    response = self.process_exception_by_middleware(e, request)
  File "django/core/handlers/base.py", line 113, in _get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
  File "django/views/generic/base.py", line 71, in view
    return self.dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "django/utils/decorators.py", line 45, in _wrapper
    return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
  File "django/views/decorators/cache.py", line 44, in _wrapped_view_func
    response = view_func(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "django/utils/decorators.py", line 45, in _wrapper
    return bound_method(*args, **kwargs)
  File "django/contrib/auth/decorators.py", line 23, in _wrapped_view
    resolved_login_url = resolve_url(login_url or settings.LOGIN_URL)
  File "django/shortcuts.py", line 139, in resolve_url
    to = str(to)
TypeError: __str__ returned non-string (type __proxy__)
[19/Jun/2020 14:48:42] "GET /rosetta/files/project/ HTTP/1.1" 500 126407
```

URL:
```
http://127.0.0.1:8000/rosetta/files/project/
```

settings.py
```
LOGIN_URL = reverse_lazy('login_signup')
```

items.title: "Unmatched variables" warning erroneously checks translator context hint
items.body: When translating a string, if the translator context hint uses string formatting syntax, the `blur` check will erroneously alert the user that there are unmatched variables in the string: I believe this is because the `blur` check does not distinguish between the original message and its translator context: https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/blob/1808edfca9ac07bfc282a8d2153f5e4566d1152f/rosetta/templates/rosetta/js/rosetta.js#L92-L95 I believe if we adjusted the `origs` selector `$('.original', $(this).parents('tr'))` to instead be `$('textarea').parents('tr').children('.original').children('.message')` we could be more specific about searching only the message and not the context. If this sounds right, I'd be happy to put together a quick PR. Questions from the issue template: - **Which version of Django are you using?**: 1.11.29. - **Which version of django-rosetta are you using?**: 0.7.13, but looking at the `master` branch I believe the bug persists. - **Have you looked trough [recent issues](https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) and checked this isn't a duplicate?** Yes, I couldn't find anything referring to the `unmatched variable` error.

items.title: Reloading WSGI after translations and ROSETTA_WSGI_AUTO_RELOAD
items.body:
- Which version of Django are you using?: 

3.0.4

- Which version of django-rosetta are you using?:

0.9.3

- Have you looked trough [recent issues](https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) and checked this isn't a duplicate?

Yes

We have enabled the setting to reload the WSGI process after translation changes are made (`ROSETTA_WSGI_AUTO_RELOAD = True`). I hunted down where this occurs in the rosetta source code, which is in `views.py`, where the file is simply touched (debugged, the file path is correct on myside):

```python
try:
    os.utime(self.request.environ.get('SCRIPT_FILENAME'), None)
except OSError:
    pass
```

I can verify that the method touching the file works to reload the server because we use that seperately in our own build pipeline to restart after pushing changes to the server, etc.

The problem is that through django-rosetta, it doesnt work. The error I actually get is the OSError for permissions on the `wsgi.py` file:

`OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied:  file/path/to/wsgi.py`

I'm not sure this is a bug of django-rosetta, or just my misunderstanding of how django works (I'm fairly new to django), but is `views.py` running under a different user? Our `wsgi.py` file has permissions 664 - that is, the owner can read/write, group can read/write, all others read only. The only thing I can imagine happening here is that `views.py` is somehow running as some other user.

Perhaps our project isn't configured correctly? We run everything inside a `virtualenv` and wsgi is operating in daemon mode with apache. All django-rosetta source files belong to our server user as well...

UPDATE: If I change the permissions of `wsgi.py` to 666 (i.e., allowing 'other' users to write as well), it works as expected. This must mean `views.py` is running as a different user...


items.title: Add ROSETTA_LANGUAGES setting
items.body:
It would be useful to have the possibility to translate for a language that is not yet in the settings.LANGUAGES, because maybe the client wants to enable that language only after the translators have finished with their work

Maybe an approach like this could be very useful (row 8)
https://github.com/deschler/django-modeltranslation/blob/master/modeltranslation/settings.py
You could use the ROSETTA_LANGUAGES as variable name

items.title: Direct URL to translated string in a language
items.body:
- Which version of Django are you using?: 1.10.5
- Which version of django-rosetta are you using?: 0.7.12

Hi, I am looking for a way to construct URL, that would lead to specific string being translated in specific language. By specific string I mean search string query, which is good enough for me.

I checked urls.py and views (namely function lang_sel).

It seems like rosetta is holding current language in session and query parameter us sent using POST.
That makes things awkward since that means I'd have to first send first request to select language and then another POST request to open the page in state I'd like.


Why is it done this way? I don't see why can't at least current lanuage/file be part of url. This makes rosetta integration with other admin tools very awkward.

Edit:
For now, I created custom view, that calls lang_sel manually and then redirects to home with query parameter, which seems to be working with GET too (views._request_request function). That kinda works, but isn't ideal.

Edit2:
I can see, there is similar #104  and hopefuly and pull request #194

items.title: Wish: Change rosetta FUZZY admin column name for more descriptive.
items.body:
Long story short:
Column fuzzy is a nightmare to explain to someone who never used this tool.
it collides with fuzzy string matching which confuses devs who think string like '*login_error' will work for de_login_error, en_login_error, general_login_error etc.
Translators does not understand what fuzzy means in this context, and misuse or don't use at all.
Everybody around seems confused,, about it's `fuzzy` meaning and behaviour. Anything more descriptive as work-in-progress, incomplete or whatever naming is more precise would appear AT LEAST on admin side.

items.title: Is it possible to not group identical strings into one translation?
items.body:
Django Rosetta Version: 0.8.1

Hi, I tried searching the documentation and the list of issues for a similar question as this and couldn't find anything related to it.

Right now Rosetta (0.8.1) groups all occurrences of the same string into one translation input. This presents a problem in some languages that I would like to translate my project to, because even though the strings can (and ideally should) be identical in English, the slight change in context between where those occurrences are, requires them to be translated differently in other languages.

Is it possible to not have Rosetta group identical strings like this?

items.title: Strings with plural forms do not show up in search
items.body:
Searching Rosetta DB does not bring up strings that have both singular and plural forms; eg in the built-in German translation file for django.conf (django/conf/locale/de/LC_MESSAGES/django.po) searching for "woch" would only give two results ("Mittwoch" and "Keine Woche angegeben"), omitting the following:

    1038 #, python-format
    1039 msgid "%d week"
    1040 msgid_plural "%d weeks"
    1041 msgstr[0] "%d Woche"
    1042 msgstr[1] "%d Wochen"

--------------------

(1, 8, 13, 'final', 0)

- Which version of django-rosetta are you using?:
(0, 7, 12)

items.title: Exception raised because of unresolved variables "do_django" and "do_rosetta"
items.body:
- Which version of Django are you using?: 
1.10.5

- Which version of django-rosetta are you using?:
0.7.12

- Have you looked trough [recent issues](https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) and checked this isn't a duplicate?
Yes

If was running Django in debug mode and found this in the logs:
```
app_1          | 2017-03-10 10:19:28,168 DEBUG [django.template:929] base 9 139644053845888 Exception while resolving variable 'do_django' in template 'rosetta/languages.html'.
app_1          | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/base.py", line 885, in _resolve_lookup
app_1          |     current = current[bit]
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/context.py", line 75, in __getitem__
app_1          |     raise KeyError(key)
app_1          | KeyError: 'do_django'
app_1          | 
app_1          | During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
app_1          | 
app_1          | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/base.py", line 891, in _resolve_lookup
app_1          |     if isinstance(current, BaseContext) and getattr(type(current), bit):
app_1          | AttributeError: type object 'RequestContext' has no attribute 'do_django'
app_1          | 
app_1          | During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
app_1          | 
app_1          | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/base.py", line 900, in _resolve_lookup
app_1          |     current = current[int(bit)]
app_1          | ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'do_django'
app_1          | 
app_1          | During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
app_1          | 
app_1          | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/base.py", line 907, in _resolve_lookup
app_1          |     (bit, current))  # missing attribute
```

and

```
app_1          | 2017-03-10 10:19:27,984 DEBUG [django.template:929] base 9 139644053845888 Exception while resolving variable 'do_rosetta' in template 'rosetta/languages.html'.
app_1          | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/base.py", line 885, in _resolve_lookup
app_1          |     current = current[bit]
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/context.py", line 75, in __getitem__
app_1          |     raise KeyError(key)
app_1          | KeyError: 'do_rosetta'
app_1          | 
app_1          | During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
app_1          | 
app_1          | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/base.py", line 891, in _resolve_lookup
app_1          |     if isinstance(current, BaseContext) and getattr(type(current), bit):
app_1          | AttributeError: type object 'RequestContext' has no attribute 'do_rosetta'
app_1          | 
app_1          | During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
app_1          | 
app_1          | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/base.py", line 900, in _resolve_lookup
app_1          |     current = current[int(bit)]
app_1          | ValueError: invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'do_rosetta'
app_1          | 
app_1          | During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
app_1          | 
app_1          | Traceback (most recent call last):
app_1          |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/django/template/base.py", line 907, in _resolve_lookup
app_1          |     (bit, current))  # missing attribute
```

It seems like do_django and do_rosetta are not provided to the template context any longer. This may be the reason why it throws the error in my logs. (it does not crash the views)

I can only find those variables in the `languages.html` template file:
https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/blob/052133fe176fd00cc2cd0ade84a1124d05bf926b/rosetta/templates/rosetta/languages.html#L43

I'm unfamiliar with the history of django-rosetta. So I'm not sure if it is safe to remove those variables (and their checks).

items.title: Reference language selector does not show up
items.body:
I set ROSETTA_ENABLE_REFLANG to True in settings, reloaded dev server, but nothing new showed up in Rosetta.

Django shell shows that setting itself is picked up by Rosetta:

    In [1]: from rosetta.conf import settings as rosetta_settings
    ...
    In [4]: getattr(settings, 'ROSETTA_ENABLE_REFLANG')
    Out[4]: True
    ...
    In [5]: getattr(rosetta_settings, 'ENABLE_REFLANG')
    Out[5]: True

Going directly to <TEST_SERVER>/rosetta/select-ref/en does nothing - navigates back to list of messages where it still shows raw msgid as source; going to <TEST_SERVER>/rosetta/select-ref/EN gives 404, as expected.

English and German translation files for the project are present and are shown in Rosetta, both languages are listed in `settings.LANGUAGES`.
We're using django-rosetta-grappelli2==1.1 if that matters.

I'd be happy to provide further information and/or run debug commands.

Thanks for the great project! It's been a great help for us.

----

- Which version of Django are you using?: 
1.8.13

- Which version of django-rosetta are you using?:
0.7.12

- Have you looked trough [recent issues](https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue) and checked this isn't a duplicate?
Yes - searching for "reference language" gives two merged PRs and one unrelated issue; searching for "reflang" and setting name variations gives nothing.

items.title: Locale formatting for Chinese script (zh_Hans vs zh_HANS)
items.body:
Hi,

I just ran into an issue with the locale for simplified Chinese characters: zh_Hans. The zh_CN and zh_TW locales were deprecated in Django 1.9 (which is good). Trouble is that Django only accepts the .mo files if they are compiled when the locale folder is formatted as zh_Hans. Unfortunately, Rosetta does not recognize this format. The locale will only show up in the Rosetta UI if the locale folder is formatted as zh_HANS (note that with one only the first letter behind the underscore is capitalized and with the other, the entire part is capitalized).

Since I didn't know which formatting was the correct one (zh_Hans or zh_HANS), Claude from the Django i18n discussion group suggests zh_Hans is the correct formatting meaning that Rosetta might need updating in this regard.

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/Django-I18N/o-H2DapWnvo

items.title: A PR to make compilation of mo file optional?
items.body:
As far I can tell, when a page of translations is saved in Rosetta the mo file is automatically compiled.

If it's automatically complied then, even if `rosetta_settings.[U]WSGI_AUTO_RELOAD` is `False`, a restart of the application outside of Rosetta will result in the translation going live, e.g. a restart as part of the application deployment process.

I have a use case where it'd be preferable for the mo file to not be automatically compiled: Translations need to go live in bulk as part of a scheduled 'translation deployment', but not inadvertently made live piecemeal as a result of day-to-day code deployments (which restart the application).

Is there interest in a PR that adds an Rosetta setting to make compilation optional? If so, I'll make it.

The setting would be called something like `rosetta_settings.AUTO_COMPILE` and default to `True` for backwards compatibility.

With this setting in place I _think_ all that'd be needed is to use it in an if-block around this code which does the compilation and, optionally, auto reloading:

https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/blob/develop/rosetta/views.py#L164-L186

(do point out if there's anything I missed, I haven't looked in detail yet).

items.title: Django 1.9 removed get_cache from django.core.cache
items.body:
Rosetta 0.7.8, Django 1.9. Using memcached backend. Error: 

```
rosetta/poutil.py
from django.core.cache import get_cache
ImportError: cannot import name 'get_cache'
```

Django 1.9 release notes: django.core.cache.get_cache is removed

items.title: API / External System Integration
items.body:
Is there a way to integrate rosetta with other systems - we use django mainly for our "pure backend" tasks and dont expose cms for our client - for that we use wordpress. Is there a way we can easily integrate rosettas interface with that system - allow wordpress users to add/edit or delete stuff using some kind of api or widget or whatever ?

Another way would be to expose some custom django views and attach them via iframe but it seems unreasonable.

Any help/advice will be appreciated

items.title: Let user propose translations using a django-inplaceedit -like mechanism
items.body:
Let user propose translations using a django-inplaceedit -like mechanism:
The user loads a page, clicks on the content, translates from scratch or reviews the translation automatically generated by the system.
When he or she clicks outside the field, it is saved as a suggestion for an admin to review.

There should be an option to either display the automatically generated translation or the original text.
There should be an option where the user can +1 ou -1 an existing translation, in context.

items.title: Any error causes rosetta to go in read-only mode
items.body: In our setup there's a chance that rosetta might get an error when saving a file even when the file is writeable. I think there should be at least some sort of explanation of the errors.

items.title: Failed to discover "zh_Hans" directory on Ubuntu server
items.body:
To be clear, this failure only occurs with a specific setup(haven't test other setups yet). It works fine on my OSX 10.9 laptop:
When running on my `Ubuntu 14.04` server hosted on Digital Ocean. It runs in a `Python3.4 virtualenv`, with `Django 1.8.1` and `django-rosetta 0.7.6` installed with `pip`.

In my django settings, I have `LANGUAGES` variable set to include `zh-hans`. I created locale folder with `python manage.py makemessages -l zh_Hans`(for some reason, Django won't discover zh_hans and zh_HANS folder in this setup). The translation works on the website. But the `zh_Hans` translation directory does not appear on `example.com/rosetta/`. Being able to discover language such as `zh_Hans` is necessary as it is the default way(see http://stackoverflow.com/a/29774856).

items.title: Button to mark everything as "not fuzzy" doesn't work
items.body:
When translating I often get lots of fuzzy matches. But the little [-] button next to the header the unmarks things as fuzzy doesn't work any more. I'm using Firefox 39 if that matters.

![skarmavbild 2015-06-04 kl 10 44 53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/224130/7980329/cdb6d1d0-0aa6-11e5-8467-d563bd5b669c.png)

items.title: Rosetta crashes for custom user models without is_superuser and groups
items.body:
Hi,
I have replaces the default User model with one that doesn't have is_superuser and groups at all. This means the the permission check when starting rosetta crashes since it expects either of those properties.

``` python
@property
def is_superuser(self):
    return True
```

Suggestion: 
- If is_superuser doesn't exist, treat it as False
- If groups doesn't exist, let me specify a list of user identifiers in settings instead. To know what field to look up the file against you can look at CustomUser.USERNAME_FIELD which is required for custom user models.

Does this make sense?

items.title: type object 'SimpleAdminConfig' has no attribute '__file__'
items.body:
Hi guys,
looks like
django.contrib.admin.apps.SimpleAdminConfig
has something wrong with rosetta.

items.title: Doesn't work over HTTPS
items.body:
Chrome refuses to load "http://www.google.com/jsapi" when the main site is loaded with HTTPS
Please change it to "//www.google.com/jsapi" in templates/rosetta/base.html
That automatically uses the same protocol as the main site and fixes the issue.
Thanks.

items.title: Bug: django-rosetta is not able to translate strings that contain a percent sign
items.body:
It's not possible to translate a text that contains a percent sign. Rosetta will quote the percent sign with another percent sign (%%) in the admin which is fine, but also in the source. That way the source doesnt match the template text anymore:

For example:

.po File:
# : templates/email_template.html:7 templates/email_template.html.py:49
# , python-format

msgid ""
"Hinweis: Du erhältst diese E-Mail aufgrund Deiner kostenlosen Anmeldung. "
"Garantie: App ist 100%% gratis!"
msgstr ""
"Note: You get this e-mail due to your free registration. We "
"guarantee: App is 100%% free of charge!"

Template text:

{% trans "Hinweis: Du erhältst diese E-Mail aufgrund Deiner kostenlosen Anmeldung. Garantie: App ist 100% gratis!" %}

This does not match because there are two percent signs in the .po File but just one percent sign in the template.

items.title: Match makemessages and django-rosetta output
items.body:
Hi, when I use django-rosetta with the default `ROSETTA_POFILE_WRAP_WIDTH` the resulting `po` file is _slightly_ different from the `makemessages` command, for example:

```
-"Vous êtes à la recherche d'une page qui n'existe pas pour le moment. Cliquez "
-"sur Précédent ou posez une question sur"
+"Vous êtes à la recherche d'une page qui n'existe pas pour le moment. Cliquez"
+" sur Précédent ou posez une question sur"
```

I also tried `--no-wrap` and `ROSETTA_POFILE_WRAP_WIDTH=0` but then the comments are different:

```
-#: foo/templates/bar.html:80
-#: foo/templates/bar.html:117
+#: foo/templates/bar.html:80 foo/templates/bar.html:117
```

I also tried `ROSETTA_POFILE_WRAP_WIDTH=79` thinking it was a one-off problem but the outputs didn't match.

Is there a configuration or parameters that make `makemessages` output match `django-rosetta` output? That would be very helpful because this file usually results in conflicts due to the big changes.

I am using:
- Django (1.6.9)
- django-rosetta (0.7.4)
- polib (1.0.4)

Thanks!

items.title: Rosetta crashes when used with a custom Djagno user lacking a first_name, last_name or email setter
items.body:
The code here 

```
https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/blob/develop/rosetta/views.py#L145 
...
        # Provide defaults in case authorization is not required.
        request.user.first_name = getattr(request.user, 'first_name', 'Anonymous')
        request.user.last_name = getattr(request.user, 'last_name', 'User')
        request.user.email = getattr(request.user, 'email', 'anonymous@user.tld')
```

assumes that request.user has settable fields. However, a model based on https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/topics/auth/customizing/#django.contrib.auth.models.AbstractBaseUser may not have them available to set (in my case, the custom user model in my web app is a wrapper for data at the other end of a service call)

Is it possible to make these fail gracefully, please? For now, I've forced my CustomUser to pretend to have those three setters (as no-ops).

items.title: Django 1.7 - exception when using AppConfig
items.body:
Currently rosetta loops through applications in `INSTALLED_APPS` and try to get `locale` directory for each app. Django 1.7. [applications refactor](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/applications/) allows to add `AppConfig` class instead of module. This makes rosetta raise exception:

```
  File ".../rosetta/poutil.py", line 83, in find_pos
    apppath = os.path.normpath(os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(app.__file__), 'locale')))
AttributeError: type object 'MYAPPCONFIG' has no attribute '__file__'
```

Workaround for this is to add this AppConfig to `ROSETTA_EXCLUDED_APPLICATIONS`.

items.title: Azure translation suggestion error
items.body:
`TranslateApiException: Cannot find an active Azure Market Place Translator Subscription associated with the request credentials. : ID=3944.V2_Json.Translate.2139BE4D`

Sometimes work, most of cases not

items.title: Rosetta should display gettext message context
items.body:
The getext message context (`msgctxt`) field provides valuable information to translators. It would be really helpful if Rosetta also displays this value, and possibly even allows filtering on it.

Currently I'm using this to filter between admin and non-admin texts, but this information can't be find anywhere in rosetta.

items.title: Release to PyPI?
items.body: I see the code on github is 0.7.5 ( as of https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/commit/68e02a3094a53b4e7bbb2ace0226ba0863257ca9 ), but the version on PyPI is 0.7.4 ( https://pypi.python.org/pypi/django-rosetta ). Would it be possible to make a software release so I could install 0.7.5 via pip/pypi?

items.title: Rosetta views broken by Django 1.7 expected behaviour
items.body:
Hi,
Clicking the "_next" button to translate a block in Django 1.7 runserver poses a problem. 

Django 1.7 docs state that "In addition, the development server automatically reloads when a translation file is updated, i.e. after running compilemessages."

That is, when you click the button, it processes the locale files, which kills and restarts the server before letting Rosetta process the rest of the view.

I don't know what to do with this. Maybe request an option to exclude files to check for a reload in Django's runserver command...

The runserver --noreload obviously fixes the problem, but --noreload is not a preferred way of using runserver.

items.title: rosatta giving error POEntry object is not JSON serializable with Django 1.6.5
items.body:
Hello and thank You for a great tool

I'm having trouble though using rosetta with Django 1.6.5

When I click on the language file I want to translate, I get the following error
TypeError at /rosetta/select/da-dk/0/
POEntry object at 0x7f2a29b602d0> is not JSON serializable

Please help

Thank You

items.title: Explicit URL structure
items.body:
I was wondering why the system works with session'ed attributes like current language and filter.

I'm pretty sure there is some reason behind that, but I would personally prefer a more explicit URL structure where you edit `/rosetta/fr/?filter=fuzzy`. This would allow deep-linking, allow for editing (or simply browsing) multiple languages in separate tabs (and not separate browsers as is now required) and just make it more transparent (and thus more pythonic).

Would there be an interest in (me working on) changing this?

items.title: Bing translate suggestion no longer works
items.body:
The Bing translate service appears to have moved to the Azure platform, and now there doesn't seem to be any clear way to get a "BING_APP_ID". I tried using my "account key" but the suggest feature reports the error:

```
ArgumentException: Invalid appId
Parameter name: appId : ID=3802.V2_Json.Translate.2A1BE722
```

items.title: Although locales are found, I can't open them.
items.body:
Hi,

I have installed rosetta, I am using django 1.4.5. At first I could not open the rosetta panel because /rosetta/ url redirected me to /accounts/login/ (although my admin user had already been logged in through the admin panel, and I am using /login/ instead of /accounts/login/ to authenticate).

So, I had to add ROSETTA_REQUIRES_AUTH = False in my settings.py file. After this, rosetta panel opened. However I only see something like this.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2423935/ros.JPG

and whenever I click on 'conf' it doesn't do anything.

What am I doing wrong?

Any ideas what should I do?

PS: I have added my admin user to the translators group, too (although it is not necessary) and admin user is always logged in.

items.title: Interface Glitches on clicks and search
items.body:
Hi,
The interface is redirecting tot he language list page when clicking and search.

Makes it unusable.. any help?

items.title: rosetta writes empty string to po file
items.body:
Hi,

When save some transaltions rosetta ads the folowing to to the po file.

msgid ""
msgstr ""
"Project-Id-Version: Django Test\n"
"Report-Msgid-Bugs-To: \n"
"POT-Creation-Date: 2013-05-28 13:53+0200\n"
"PO-Revision-Date: 2013-08-21 13:02+0000\n"
"Last-Translator:   mail@example.com\n"
"Language-Team: This that mail@example.com\n"
"MIME-Version: 1.0\n"
"Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8\n"
"Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit\n"
"Language: \n"
"Plural-Forms: nplurals=2; plural=(n > 1)\n"
"X-Poedit-Country: FRANCE\n"
"X-Poedit-Language: French\n"
"X-Poedit-SourceCharset: utf-8\n"
"X-Translated-Using: django-rosetta 0.7.2\n"

Which in the end make the translation of any empty string into the above text , is this bug or the expected behavior ?

items.title: rosetta_i18n_catalog_filter in languages.html is always empty
items.body: there is a {% ifequal rosetta_i18n_catalog_filter 'something' %} in languages.html template, but the variable is not defined in the context, so the active button highlight doesn't work.

items.title: Keyboard shortcuts
items.body:
It would be nice if one could control rosetta with keyboard shortcuts...

examples: 
- save file
- copy from original
- restart wsgi process

items.title: Copy from original
items.body: There should be button or something to copy translation from original - something that poeditor does have

items.title: Tests modify global state (settings.LANGUAGES) and don't restore original state after run
items.body:
This causes issues with test isolation - if I were to run my application's business test in the same run as rosetta's tests, I would have my application's tests failing that may rely on the settings.

The offending line is in RosettaTestCase.setUp (https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/blob/44b3314fd4eac955be18f745e28c9d874d1c9ac2/rosetta/tests/__init__.py#L53) 

The way I usually address these issues is by storing the original value of the setting my tests modify, and then restore them in the tearDown method

items.title: Urls reversing not working on Django 1.5.1
items.body:
The url reverse in Django 1.5.1 is now in the format {% url 'app:url_name' %}, which is not compatible anymore with the current Rosetta templates.

Error is the following:

`TemplateSyntaxError: Could not parse the remainder: '-pick-file' from 'rosetta-pick-file'. The syntax of 'url' changed in Django 1.5, see the docs.`

Any chance this could be updated to Django 1.5.1?

items.title: Option to hide file name & path - feature request
items.body:
For security reason it would be great if there was an option to not display information about the file the string is used in. (both file & full path).

This would be useful if you deletage translating to some external company/translator.

Thanks

items.title: module named six
items.body:
Hello i am using django 1.5 with custom auth. I have installed development branch of rosetta in order to use it with django 1.5.
I am getting module named six error when try to reach http://127.0.0.1:8000/rosetta/

items.title: NoneType object has no attribute split
items.body:
Hi all,

I'm using Django 1.4 and rosetta 0.6.8.

Somehow when I translate a few entries and click at the save button a few times, or even when I just click at the paginator links, after a few clicks I end up with this error message.

The problem can be resolved by restarting Apache. 

Does anyone know what could be causing this?

items.title: Fail on unicode appname.
items.body:
I had this error thrown on  rosetta/poutil.py line 76

app = getattr(**import**(appname[:p], {}, {}, [appname[p + 1:]]), appname[p + 1:])
TypeError: Item in ``from list'' not a string

I'm French and I use in my settings.py. I use python 2.7/2.6
    from **future** import unicode_literals

I found how to fix it with this stackoverflow answer:
http://stackoverflow.com/a/2683624/267364

So, putting a b prefix to have non unicode appname look required for this application to work for python 2 when the rest of django's environnement is ok. maybe you may want to user an str cast on appname to fix it. (will work with both unicode and non unicode appname for python 2, and probably python 3 as import should take unicode literals.)

items.title: Please upload 0.7.0 to PyPI, Django 1.5 is broken with current PyPI version
items.body: PyPI has 0.6.8 which doesn't work with Django 1.5. Please upload 0.7.0 to PyPI.

items.title: local dir in project root is ignored
items.body: I use one project wide locale/ directory in the project root (same dir as manage.py) but i am unable to get rosetta to detect these localisation files. I've tried both the stable and develop (0.7.0) release and both show the django and third-party messages in the overview but the project overview just says "Nothing to translate!".

items.title: Save redirect not working and occasionally failing to save
items.body:
The initial problem I have is that the "save and translate next block" doesn't navigate forward to the next block, it simply saves the translations on the current page and redisplays it. 

After hitting save, it is possible to move forward manually using the numbered page links which is what I've asked my translator to do.

However the bigger problem is that after repeating the above for several pages, on the ~6th page of translations the save button redirects back to the Language selection page and the most recent set of translations are lost. Previously saved pages are retained.

Seems likely to be an issue with session/caching but I have no idea where to start....

Django 1.4 and Rosetta 0.6.8. 

I experience the issue under two server configurations:
- nginx in front of Gunicorn
- 'runserver' (daemonised under screen)

Configuration:

ROSETTA_STORAGE_CLASS = 'rosetta.storage.CacheRosettaStorage'
SESSION_COOKIE_SECURE = False
CACHES = {
          'default': {
             'BACKEND': 'django.core.cache.backends.locmem.LocMemCache',
             'LOCATION': 'dwight-dev',
         }
}

items.title: django 1.5a issue with 'rosetta-pick-file'
items.body:
TemplateSyntaxError at /rosetta/
Could not parse the remainder: '-pick-file' from 'rosetta-pick-file'
In template /flow/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/rosetta/templates/rosetta/languages.html, error at line 7

Looks like django 1.5 doesn't support this sort of url names.

items.title: Problem on production server
items.body:
Hi. on my production server i use MemcachedCache
And when i click link to select lang (/rosetta/select/en/0/) i redirect to home without form to edit translations

On my locale mac this work fine

items.title: Displays application twice when using a language code with an underscore
items.body: I have a PO directory called en_US. In the admin panel, rosetta displays both en_US and en_us. Only editing en_us does any actual updates to the translation files.

items.title: Can't click language files from /rosetta/ in non chrome browser on osx.
items.body:
On the main listing page for the language files I can' click on a file to go to the next page.   It just reloads the current page over and over again,   I can make it go by repeatedly and rapidly clicking the link.

Chrome doesn't appear to have this issue but firefox and safari both do on OSX 10.8.  

THe link appears to go to http://<my_domain>.com/rosetta/select/fr/0/ however clicking it just reloads /rosetta/.

Have I included URLs improperly somewhere?

items.title: Move from Bing to Azure for translation suggestions
items.body:
Microsoft Translator API has moved to Azure DataMarket. I believe, currently the Bing API is still working despite Microsoft's announcement of terminating the service as of August 1st, 2012. Not sure about that, but it's probably a good idea to move to Azure ... it's actually just changing a few lines of codes and introducing two new values as a replacement for BING_APP_ID in settings.py.

Here's how to use Microsofts translator on Azure:
https://github.com/openlabs/Microsoft-Translator-Python-API

Kind regards

items.title: Language is duplicated in language selection
items.body:
I have zh-cn in languages

```
LANGUAGES = (
    ('en', gettext('English')),
    ('zh-cn', gettext('Mandarin Chinese')),
)
```

In mac os file system is case insensitive and on the language selection page I'm getting two rows with files
/locale/zh_CN/LC_MESSAGES/django.po
/locale/zh_cn/LC_MESSAGES/django.po

items.title: Reload .po file
items.body:
If I add a new trans/blocktrans in a template, for example, it would appear there's no
way to get it into Rosetta without executing makemessages from the shell.

Could this be implemented?

items.title: Not working with signed_cookie session backend
items.body:
Hi MBI,

I finally got the time to track down the bug I reported a while ago:

Rosetta is not working, when cookie-based sessions are enabled. That's a new session backend on Django 1.4:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/http/sessions/#using-cookie-based-sessions

Since you store the whole PO file in sessions, the cookie can easily exceed the common 4 kb limit and thus, simply gets deleted before it's processed. That's what happens in _all_ our projects. I don't know how big your PO files are or if you ever tested against the cookie-based session backend ... to enable and check this bug, add the following line to your settings.py:

SESSION_ENGINE = 'django.contrib.sessions.backends.signed_cookies'

Then _try_ selecting a reasonably sized PO file in Rosetta, that exceeds 4 kb.

p.s.
I fixed it by not writing the whole PO data into the session, but reading it directly from the PO file as needed. However, I assume, there will be issues, since you would have done that in the first place. I can send you the modified views.py if you like.

p.s.s.
Also, could you please add #toolbar {height:20px;overflow:hidden;} to your css style sheet. The layout bug is still there in FF 12.0, even if you can't see it: https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/issues/27

items.title: Rosetta doesn't work with "feature url tag"
items.body:
I use "url" tag from feature library - in my settings.py file, there is:

import django.template
django.template.add_to_builtins('django.templatetags.future')

... and then rosetta says:

TemplateSyntaxError at /rosetta/
Could not parse the remainder: '-pick-file' from 'rosetta-pick-file'

items.title: Support for django==1.4
items.body:
Using django 1.4 rosetta raises 
AttributeError at /rosetta/
'Settings' object has no attribute 'ADMIN_MEDIA_PREFIX'

ADMIN_MEDIA_PREFIX is now deprecated due to https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/releases/1.4/#django-contrib-admin

items.title: user access to rosetta
items.body:
task: 
user has to edit translations without access to admin interface
problem:
user has to be marked as superuser and staff ( http://code.google.com/p/django-rosetta/issues/detail?id=92 ), but this also grants user an access to admin interface. adding to group "translators" doesn't work as well

items.title: Support for msgctxt option
items.body:
When trying to save a translation string that has the `msgctxt` parameter, whatever you type in seems not to be saved. The form is submitted but changes are not applied. Furthermore, the translator's view shows the context hint but no longer shows the translator's hint text:

An example would be:

forms.py:

```
# Translators: this is a note to translators
label = pgettext_lazy("Street Address", "Address")
```

output of `makemessages` command:

```
#. Translators: this is a note to translators
#: forms.py:123
msgctxt "Street Address"
msgid "Address"
msgstr ""
```

The above is what is output by django's `makemessages` command.

Is the `msgctxt` parameter supported by rosetta?

items.title: Layout bug in Firefox 10+
items.body:
In Firefox version 10+ the translation table with all the message files is shifted to the right - as far as the end of the search form above. Please ad an overflow:hidden to #toolbar in rosetta.css to fix it:
# toolbar { height:20px;overflow: hidden}

Or place a <br style="clear: both;" /> below the toolbar <div> tag.

Thanks for the great app!!

items.title: Disable fuzzy strings
items.body:
Having two different kinds of translations (fuzzy, and untranslated) confuses new translators in our code-base. So we would like to disable the fuzziness matching, and show all strings as untranslated instead. So this is a feature request for a setting that does this.

Ideally, this should be done in Django, but they have firmly stated that feature as wontfix: https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/10852 - so I'm hoping you will take up this usability issue instead :)

items.title: Support --no-wrap option and/or different line wrap lengths
items.body:
I am constantly having issues where the `manage.py makemessages` command which I use to update the file line numbers with creates strings where the line wrap occurs at a different point than when the files are saved by translators using rosetta. This means that diffs include a lot of noise where the only change is a single word on the following line.

I can turn off line wrapping with the `--no-wrap` option in makemessages but there is no similar capability in rosetta. It seems like [polib supports this](http://polib.readthedocs.org/en/latest/api.html#polib.pofile) to some extent. I would assume setting `wrapwidth` to 0 would do it. Would it be possible to add a `ROSETTA_WRAPWIDTH` setting?

items.title: Percent sign does not get escaped?
items.body:
When i translate a text that contains a percent sign (see example below) I get fatal errors when trying to compile it. Rosetta doesn't seem to escape percent signs?

Original text: "Searches on the web with mobile devices have increased with 400% since last year."
Swedish translation: "Mobila sökningar har ökat med 400% det senaste året."

Error message from compilemessages:
/sv/LC_MESSAGES/django.po:1705: number of format specifications in 'msgid' and 'msgstr' does not match

And the translation module then throws the following error:
TypeError: %d format: a number is required, not dict

items.title: Translation Suggestions
items.body:
I'm using Rosetta 0.6.4.

I enabled the translation suggestions via Bing, but I can't see any button/link to trigger them...

settings.py:

```
# Rosetta configuration
ROSETTA_MESSAGES_PER_PAGE = 20
ENABLE_TRANSLATION_SUGGESTIONS = True
BING_APP_ID = 'my_id'
ROSETTA_MESSAGES_SOURCE_LANGUAGE_CODE = 'de'
ROSETTA_MESSAGES_SOURCE_LANGUAGE_NAME = 'German'
```

The `ROSETTA_MESSAGES_PER_PAGE` option works, so the configuration should basically work.

PS: Thanks for making this amazing app :)

items.title: changeable messages file name
items.body: The current code allows only 'django.po' files to be used, and as I found a way to use this helpful application in some non-fully django projects, it would be better if we could specify in our settings file at least for which filenames to look for.

items.title: wish: un-tick 'fuzzy' when a translation is changed
items.body:
It would be really nice if we could add some JavaScript (probably?) to un-check the fuzzy flag, when a translation changes.

We found some of our users forget to do this otherwise.

items.title: Translation suggestions don't work
items.body:
The "Suggestion" links within Rosetta no longer work.  When the user clicks on a Suggestion link, the text "Please use Translate v2. See http://code.google.com/apis/language/translate/overview.html" appears below the item the user attempted to translate.

This is because the Google Translate API v1 has been deprecated.  Version 2 is paid-only so something other than the google translate api must be used.

items.title: Submit button doesn't redirect to next page
items.body:
The "Save and translate next block" saves but doesn't bring me to the next page.

pretty obvious, so i thought it was my fault. but i debugged the code and i'm pretty sure now...its a bug.

i'm using django-rosetta 0.6.2 and django-trunk.

regards,
klemens

items.title: Use of messages variable causes conflict in django messages framework
items.body:
Hi,

we use the django messages framework to pass notices to pages in our website. Unfortunately rosetta uses the local variable messages (line 200 in views.py). Due to the variable being named "messages" and the variable being returned in the response context we've found that the messages framework gets trodden on.

Would it be possible to use a different name for this variable in views.py (and pofile.html)?

items.title: Plural forms are broken for languages with more than two of them
items.body: For example, Russian has three forms, however Rosetta fails to display input fields for all of them -- only two are shown. Even Rosetta's own translation has only two forms instead of three (https://github.com/mbi/django-rosetta/blob/develop/rosetta/locale/ru/LC_MESSAGES/django.po).
